entry.title: Armenia‚Äôs national debt rises to $12 billion: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs national debt rises to $12 billion: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia‚Äôs national debt surpassed $12 billion, rising by 1.9% since the beginning of the year. The country‚Äôs debt-to-GDP ratio now stands at 48.1%. üìç Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan‚Äôs cabinet dissolved the Armenian National Interests Fund, a state-owned enterprise meant to co-invest in major projects alongside foreign entrepreneurs, amid mounting allegations of corruption and mismanagement. üìç Lawmakers began debating a bill to introduce a corporate governance code in Armenia.

entry.title: Police officers injured after confrontation with protesters

media:group.media:title: Police officers injured after confrontation with protesters
media:group.media:description:
üìç As of this afternoon, at least 29 protesters have been detained and three police officers injured as daily anti-government protests escalate sharply outside the Foreign Ministry building in central Yerevan. üìç Armenia did not take part in another gathering of the Collective Security Treaty Organization, as it continues to keep its distance from the Russian-led security bloc. üìç The Armenian government is asking international donors and governments for assistance in rebuilding communities after a devastating flood which left four people dead. üìç Former President Serzh Sargsyan acquitted of embezzlement charges.

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs foreign intelligence chief says country faces threats to its sovereignty
media:group.media:description:
üìç Law enforcement detained at least nine demonstrators as protest leader Archbishop Bagrat Galstanyan attempted to gain entrance to Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan‚Äôs weekly cabinet meeting. üìç The head of Armenia‚Äôs Foreign Intelligence Service indicated a number of countries are threatening Armenia‚Äôs sovereignty and independence, but did not specify names. üìç Interview with French Ambassador Olivier Decottignies: https://www.civilnet.am/en/news/779382/delimitation-means-that-azerbaijan-must-withdraw-french-ambassador-olivier-decottignies/ üìç Insights with Eric Hacopian: https://youtu.be/fbjgUUiqkSU
